Content: An event was held at the Parliamentary Complex to launch a book authored by Deputy Speaker Thilanga Sumathipala on Tuesday, December 01 The book titled Thilanga in Parliament consists of 45 speeches made by Deputy Speaker Thilanga Sumathipala in Parliament. The event was graced by a visiting Russian Parliamentary Delegation including the Deputy Speaker of the Upper House of the Russian Parliament. Prime Minister, Ranil Wickremesinghe stated that they have to provide facilities to members of parliament as the parliament becomes stronger. The Prime Minister stated: At present they have discussed the possibility of the jparliament becoming a Constitutional Assembly, to draft a constitution, present it back to the Parliament for the final enactment. And then it will go before the people. Deputy Speaker, Thilanga Sumathipala stated: Back in 2010 when he walked into parliament he had to spend around two to three days to speak for ten minutes, and do research for about a week. The launch was held under the auspices of Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe and saw the participation of Speaker Karu Jayasuriya and several parliamentarians. Speaker, Karu Jayasuriya stated: Next year they are planning on several visits as there are considerable interests on the part of several countries to strengthen the cordiality.
